perturbation.original_text:
7.       Lucent is generally aware of the current quality of mPhase's Goods.
         mPhase agrees to maintain the quality of its Goods associated with the
         Lucent Co-Branding Logo to a level of quality comparable to the current
         quality of their Goods.
perturbation.changed_text:
7.       Lucent is generally aware of the current quality of mPhase's Goods.
         mPhase agrees to maintain the quality of its Goods associated with the
         Lucent Co-Branding Logo; however, mPhase is not obligated to maintain a specific quality level, as long as they make reasonable efforts.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces ambiguity in the quality standards. Initially, mPhase was required to maintain a quality comparable to the current quality. Now, it states they are only obligated to make 'reasonable efforts,' contradicting the implied strict adherence to a quality level, thus creating uncertainty about the required quality standard.

perturbation.original_text:
11.      The Term of this Agreement will commence on the date above, and shall
         continue for a term of one (1) year. mPhase shall have the right to
         annually renew this agreement for a period of one year upon each annual
         expiration with the written consent of Lucent, which written consent
         shall not be unreasonably withheld. Either party wishing to terminate
         the Agreement must give written notice to the other party at least
         thirty (30) days prior to the desired date of termination.
perturbation.changed_text:
11.      The Term of this Agreement will commence on the date above, and shall
         continue for a term of one (1) year. mPhase shall have the right to
         annually renew this agreement for a period of one year upon each annual
         expiration with the written consent of Lucent, which written consent
         shall not be unreasonably withheld. Either party wishing to terminate
         the Agreement must give written notice to the other party with immediate effect.
perturbation.explanation: The original text requires a 30-day notice for termination. The changed text allows either party to terminate with immediate effect, creating a contradiction in the termination process.

perturbation.original_text:
9.       mPhase agrees to allow Lucent to inspect the Approved Uses bearing the
         Lucent Co-Branding Logo, to ensure that those uses reviewed and
         approved pursuant to the procedure set forth in Schedule B continue to
         be in compliance with the terms of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
9.       mPhase agrees to allow Lucent to inspect the Approved Uses bearing the
         Lucent Co-Branding Logo only upon prior written notice of 60 days, but Lucent has the right to immediate inspection if any consumer complaints arise.
perturbation.explanation: This creates a contradiction regarding inspection rights. The original text implies unconditional access for inspection. The modified text introduces a 60-day notice period, but then provides an exception for immediate inspection if consumer complaints arise, making the terms unclear and contradictory.
